name: Arberry
text: Sad. By the Koran, containing the Remembrance --

name: Arberry
text: nay, but the unbelievers glory in their schism.

name: Arberry
text: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they called, but time was none to escape.

name: Arberry
text: Now they marvel that a warner has come to them from among them; and the unbelievers say, 'This is a lying sorcerer.

name: Arberry
text: What, has he made the gods One God? This is indeed a marvellous thing.'

name: Arberry
text: And the Council of them depart, saying 'Go! Be steadfast to your gods; this is a thing to be desired.

name: Arberry
text: We have not heard of this in the last religion; this is surely an invention.

name: Arberry
text: What, has the Remembrance been sent down on him out of us all?' Nay, but they are in doubt of My Remembrance; nay, they have not yet tasted My chastisement.

name: Arberry
text: Or have they the treasuries of thy Lord's mercy, the All-mighty, the All-giving?

name: Arberry
text: Or is theirs the kingdom of the heavens and earth and of what between them is? Why, then let them ascend the cords!

name: Arberry
text: A very host of parties is routed there!

name: Arberry
text: Cried lies before them the people of Noah, and Ad, and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,

name: Arberry
text: and Thamood, and the people of Lot, and the men of the Thicket - those were the parties;

name: Arberry
text: not one, that cried not lies to the Messengers, so My retribution was just.

name: Arberry
text: These are only awaiting for a single Cry, to which there is no delay.

name: Arberry
text: They say, 'Our Lord, hasten to us our share before the Day of Reckoning.'

name: Arberry
text: Bear patiently what they say, and remember Our servant David, the man of might; he was a penitent.

name: Arberry
text: With him We subjected the mountains to give glory at evening and sunrise,

name: Arberry
text: and the birds, duly mustered, every one to him reverting;

name: Arberry
text: We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and speech decisive.

name: Arberry
text: Has the tiding of the dispute come to thee? When they scaled the Sanctuary,

name: Arberry
text: when they entered upon David, and he took fright at them; and they said, 'Fear not; two disputants we are -- one of us has injured the other; so judge between us justly, and transgress not, and guide us to the right path.'

name: Arberry
text: 'Behold, this my brother has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe. So he said, "Give her into my charge"; and he overcame me in the argument.'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!' And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.

name: Arberry
text: Accordingly We forgave him that, and he has a near place in Our presence and a fair resort.

name: Arberry
text: 'David, behold, We have appointed thee a viceroy in the earth; therefore judge between men justly, and follow not caprice, lest it lead thee astray from the way of God. Surely those who go astray from the way of God -- there awaits them a terrible chastisement, for that they have forgotten the Day of Reckoning.'

name: Arberry
text: We have not created the heavens and earth, and what between them is, for vanity; such is the thought of the unbelievers, wherefore woe unto the unbelievers because of the Fire!

name: Arberry
text: Or shall We make those who believe and do righteous deeds as the workers of corruption in the earth, or shall We make the godfearing as the transgressors?

name: Arberry
text: A Book We have sent down to thee, Blessed, that men possessed of minds may ponder its signs and so remember.

name: Arberry
text: And We gave unto David Solomon; how excellent a servant he was! He was a penitent.

name: Arberry
text: When in the evening were presented to him the standing steeds,

name: Arberry
text: he said, 'Lo, I have loved the love of good things better than the remembrance of my Lord, until the sun was bidden behind the veil.

name: Arberry
text: Return them to me!' And he began to stroke their shanks and necks.

name: Arberry
text: Certainly We tried Solomon, and We cast upon his throne a mere body; then he repented.

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'My Lord, forgive me, and give me a kingdom such as may not befall anyone after me; surely Thou art the All-giver.'

name: Arberry
text: So We subjected to him the wind, that ran at his commandment, softly, wherever he might light on,

name: Arberry
text: and the Satans, every builder and diver

name: Arberry
text: and others also, coupled in fetters:

name: Arberry
text: 'This is Our gift; bestow or withhold without reckoning.'

name: Arberry
text: And he had a near place in Our presence and a fair resort.

name: Arberry
text: Remember also Our servant Job; when he called to his Lord, 'Behold, Satan has visited me with weariness and chastisement.'

name: Arberry
text: 'Stamp thy foot! This is a laving-place cool, and a drink.'

name: Arberry
text: And We gave to him his family, and the like of them with them, as a mercy from us, and a reminder unto men possessed of minds;

name: Arberry
text: and, 'Take in thy hand a bundle of rushes, and strike therewith, and do not fail in thy oath.' Surely We found him a steadfast man. How excellent a servant he was! He was a penitent.

name: Arberry
text: Remember also Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob -- men of might they and of vision.

name: Arberry
text: Assuredly We purified them with a quality most pure, the remembrance of the Abode,

name: Arberry
text: and in Our sight they are of the chosen, the excellent.

name: Arberry
text: Remember also Our servants Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul Kifl; each is among the excellent.

name: Arberry
text: This is a Remembrance; and for the godfearing is a fair resort,

name: Arberry
text: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are open to them,

name: Arberry
text: wherein they recline, and wherein they call for fruits abundant, and sweet potions,

name: Arberry
text: and with them maidens restraining their glances of equal age.

name: Arberry
text: 'This is what you were promised for the Day of Reckoning;

name: Arberry
text: this is Our provision, unto which there is no end.'

name: Arberry
text: All this; but for the insolent awaits an ill resort,

name: Arberry
text: Gehenna, wherein they are roasted - an evil cradling!

name: Arberry
text: All this; so let them taste it - boiling water and pus,

name: Arberry
text: and other torments of the like kind coupled together.

name: Arberry
text: 'This is a troop rushing in with you; there is no Welcome for them; they shall roast in the Fire.'

name: Arberry
text: They say, 'No, it is you have no Welcome; you forwarded it for us; how evil a stablishment!'

name: Arberry
text: They say, 'Our Lord, whoso forwarded this for us, give him a double chastisement in the Fire!'

name: Arberry
text: They say, 'How is it with us, that we do not see men here that we counted among the wicked?

name: Arberry
text: What, did we take them for a laughing-stock? Or have our eyes swerved away from them?'

name: Arberry
text: Surely that is true -- the disputing of the inhabitants of the Fire.

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'I am only a warner. There is not any god but God, the One, the Omnipotent,

name: Arberry
text: Lord of the heavens and earth, and of what between them is, the All-mighty, the All-forgiving.'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'It is a mighty tiding

name: Arberry
text: from which you are turning away.

name: Arberry
text: I had no knowledge of the High Council when they disputed.

name: Arberry
text: This alone is revealed to me, that I am only a clear warner.'

name: Arberry
text: When thy Lord said to the angels, 'See, I am creating a mortal of a clay.

name: Arberry
text: When I have shaped him, and breathed My spirit in him, fall you down, bowing before him!'

name: Arberry
text: Then the angels bowed themselves all together,

name: Arberry
text: save Iblis; he waxed proud, and was one of the unbelievers.

name: Arberry
text: Said He, 'Iblis, what prevented thee to bow thyself before that I created with My own hands? Hast thou waxed proud, or art thou of the lofty ones?'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'I am better than he; Thou createdst me of fire, and him Thou createdst of clay.'

name: Arberry
text: Said He, 'Then go thou forth hence; thou art accursed.

name: Arberry
text: Upon thee shall rest My curse, till the Day of Doom.'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.'

name: Arberry
text: Said He, 'Thou art among the ones that are respited

name: Arberry
text: until the day of the known time.'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'Now, by Thy glory, I shall pervert them all together,

name: Arberry
text: excepting those Thy servants among them that are sincere.'

name: Arberry
text: Said He, 'This is the truth, and the truth I say;

name: Arberry
text: I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with thee, and with whosoever of them follows thee, all together.'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'I ask of you no wage for it, neither am I of those who take things upon themselves.

name: Arberry
text: It is nothing but a reminder unto all beings,

name: Arberry
text: and you shall surely know its tiding after a while.'
